item.title: Iran | Approved suspension of cooperation with the AIEA
item.description: The Iranian Parliament yesterday voted to suspend cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency following 12-day war marked by Israeli and Americans attacks against Iran's nuclear facilities. Iranian Parliament President Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf said the International Atomic Energy Agency (AIEA) refused to condemn the attack on Iranian nuclear facilities, compromising the international credibility of the United Nations. Ghalibaf's statements occurred after the deputies voted in favor of the suspension of cooperation with AIEA. "The Iranian organization of atomic energy will suspend cooperation with AIEA while the safety of nuclear facilities is not guaranteed," added the president of Parliament of Teerão. On June 13, Israel, with the support of the United States, attacked Iranian military and nuclear facilities. Iran retaliated firing missiles and launching unmanned air appliances against Israel. The ceasefire was agreed on Tuesday, after intervention by the US Administration.

item.title: Coutinho wants direct flights between Macau and Portugal
item.description: Deputy José Pereira Coutinho defended direct flights to Portugal yesterday and warned that restrictions on annual financial aid given to the residents of the Chinese region will affect reformed in Portugal. “We have to transform Macao International Airport, in fact with direct air routes to Europe, namely to Portugal,” Coutinho said after the presentation of the political program of the Nova Esperança list to the local parliament. The jurist said the largest long -haul aircraft in the world can land in Macao, but a lack of space to park aircraft, a problem that said he expected to be solved by expanding the infrastructure. The expansion of the airport, launched in November, involves the construction of a landfill with more than 129 hectares and is expected to be over in 2030, increasing the capacity of 9.6 million to 13 million passengers per year. "We hope that in the future it is not necessary to move to Hong Kong to take an international flight to Europe or America and we can start the trip in Macao which is our home," said Coutinho. Macao airport currently has regular passenger flights operated by 27 airlines to 41 destinations in mainland China, Taiwan, Southeast Asia, Japan and South Korea. Criticized cuts On the other hand, Coutinho criticized local government's decision to restrict financial aids given annually to people with resident status to those who in 2024 resided in the region at least 183 days. The measure provides for exceptions, including for those living in nine cities of mainland China integrated in the Great Guandong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay project and those studying at universities abroad. But Coutinho warned that the exceptions did not eliminate all injustices, namely cases of retired people living in Portugal. The deputy gave the example of a former Portuguese soldier, “almost 90 years old”, who worked for 40 years as a police in Macao, but has no right to financial aid for going to live with his daughter in Portugal after being widowed. "Do you think it is fair?" Coutinho asked the journalists. The Nova Esperança political program also advocates "a deeper realization" of the role of Macao as a cooperation platform with Portuguese -speaking countries, "with the greater participation of the population and entrepreneurs." item.title: Silk Route | Talent Training Program started in Beijing
item.description: It was officially launched in Beijing, on the 16th, the talent formation program in the areas of cultural and creative design of the Seda Maritime Route, supported by MGM and selected for funding from the China National Arts Fund (FNAC) this year. In a press release, it is described how this program will be developed in collaboration with the Palace Museum and the Fashion Technology Institute, both based in Beijing. The idea is to train “an elite education team” that, for 60 days of “intensive courses and field studies”, will explore “several key points along the silk sea route”. The program, entitled “Training of Talents in Cultural and Creative Design for the Silk's Maritime Route”, aims to promote “Innovative Research and Innovative Transformation of the Cultural and Historical Heritage of the Silk Maritime Route, forming related talents, highlighting the fundamental role of Macau as a bridge between Chinese and Western cultures”. The program proposes a “multifaceted formation that combines theory, field studies and practice, with the aim of transforming participants into professionals, communicators and promoters of cultural heritage and creativity”, aiming to “cultivate new talents for the development of creative and cultural tourism industries in the great Guangdong-Hong Bay Kong-Macau, also contributing to the continuity of the silk route cultural legacy”. 30 participants were chosen, “including professionals from the cultural and arts heritage sectors, academic and doctoral researchers”, and after Beijing, the program continues in Quanzhou, Guangzhou, Hengqin and Macau, “offering distinct learning experiences”. After these face -to -face sessions, participants will enter a creative online phase to refine their work through continuous dialogue with instructors. The final results will be revealed in the first quarter of 2026, highlights MGM in a press release.

item.title: Justice | Isabel Chiang Heritage in Public Hasta
item.description:
The businesswoman, linked to several slops, was declared bankrupt in October 2019, and more than 200 creditors, including businessman Chan Meng Kam, hope to see their debts paid with the sale of 23 properties valued at at least 147.28 million patacas
About 23 properties belonging to businesswoman Isabel Chiang were placed in auction to pay debts to more than 200 creditors, according to the Fasome Court Portal. The businesswoman, who is in an uncertain place, was accused in 2019 by several entrepreneurs, including Chan Meng Kam to have loans and promote investment schemes without intending to return the money. Properties, which are not limited to apartments, and include at least one building in their entirety, were valued with a base sales value of about 147.28 million patacas. The highest value of the goods for sale is 28.96 million patacas and concerns a shopping center with chirping and three floors on the Rua dos Erváranas. Among the most valuable goods, there are also a two-floor apartment in a building on Sagres Avenue, valued at 21.72 million patacas, as well as a Cave in the São Lázaro courtyard, valued at 15.16 million patacas. The properties are being sold through the presentation of proposals by closed letter, and with two different sales processes, although both have as a deadline of July 17. Creditors include Chan Meng Kam, but also members linked to the Portuguese community, such as Armando de Jesus, former communities counselor. However, the list also includes the CEM Electricity Supply Company and several banks, such as the National Bank Overseas, Macao branch of Banco da China, ICBC or Tai Fung. Promised land In 2019, when the scandal with Isabel Chiang Bailed, the businesswoman was accused of borrowing or promoting investments with high returns in the development of Rua dos Erváranas, near the ruins of Sao Paulo, and also in Pátio Chon Sau or Rua da Nossa Senhora do Amparo. By 2015, the businesswoman will have spent at least 100 million patacas to buy stores in this area. Part of the money used for these purchases, it will have had its origin Chan Meng Kam, who acknowledged having lent money to the businesswoman, having received two properties as warranty. However, later, when the money was returned, Chan realized that the properties had been used as a guarantee for other loans. The case led to an investigation from the Judicial Police that in 2019 acknowledged that there would be more than 30 victims of the slopping, with the losses evaluated in at least 200 million patacas. Isabel Chiang was declared insolvent on October 3, 2019, according to a notice published in the official bulletin.

item.title: Financial Reserve | Registered higher value since 2021
item.description:
Macao's financial reserve assets reached 632.6 billion Patacas at the end of April, the highest value since the end of 2021. In the first four months of 2025, the reserve grew 16.3 billion patacas, more than half of that amount was added in April
According to a balance published yesterday in the official bulletin by the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM), the reserve has been at the highest level since registered in December 2021: 643.2 billion. Still, it remains far from the historical record of 663.6 billion patacas, reached in late February 2021, although the territory is in the middle of covid-19 pandemic. The reserve began 2025 on the rise, with the value of the assets rising 16.3 billion patacas in the first four months. More than half of this amount (8.99 billion of patacas) was won only in April. Official data show that it is the best start of year since the first four months of 2021, when the reserve valued at 42.7 billion patacas. According to AMCM, the reserve had registered in 2024 the best year since the pandemic, earning 35.7 billion patacas. This was the highest annual increase since 2019, when the value of the reserve increased by 70.6 billion patacas. The value of the extraordinary reserve at the end of April this year was 459.7 billion Patacas and the basic reserve, equivalent to 150 percent of the Macao Public Budget, was 164.2 billion patacas. Backdrop The initial budget of the territory for 2025 provides for a 7 percent increase in total expenses to 109.4 billion patacas. The Legislative Assembly is currently discussing a proposal submitted by the government for a new budget, which includes an extra increase of 2.86 billion Patacas in expenses. The Macao Financial Reserve is mostly composed of 257.8 billion Patacas in subcontracted investments, deposits and current accounts of 252.9 billion patacas and even credit securities in the amount of 116.6 billion. In 2024, investments surrendered to the financial reserve nearly 31 billion patacas, corresponding to a 5.3 percent profitability rate, AMCM said in late February.

item.title: Elections | Rita Santos leaves the race and Coutinho says she is Cristiano Ronaldo
item.description:
The ATFPM deputy devalued the withdrawal of Rita Santos's elections, as Cristiano Ronaldo from the Nova Esperança list. In turn, Rita Santos says she will devote more time to the family. Still will again assume the functions of advisor to the Portuguese communities
José Pereira Coutinho will be the first candidate on the Nova Esperança list, which highlights the absence of Rita Santos, who was nominated by the deputy as a candidate of the list in an eligible place. Minutes before the presentation of the list, which took place yesterday afternoon, the president of the General Assembly of the Macao Public Function Association (ATFPM) shared a video on social networks to announce that he would not be a candidate, for wanting to spend more time with his family. The absence was devalued by José Pereira Coutinho who, through the analogy with the captain of the Portuguese football team, Cristiano Ronaldo, declined the idea that the list was deprived of a member with unique quality and a lot of experience: “In New Hope, Cristiano Ronaldo is me, I am Cristiano Ronaldo,” said the deputy, with Rita Santos and the other members of the list next door. The legislator also said that the deputy position requires dedication and time, with personal loss, and indicated that Rita Santos did not want to make this sacrifice: “Who has no temporal availability, because there are family, children and grandchildren to follow and gives the priority to grandson, so my dear friend, I can not accept [this person on the list]. Coutinho. "We are very friends since childhood, but one thing is bread, bread, something is cheese, cheese," he added. Despite the candidacy for deputy, a political office, José Pereira Coutinho refused that the list of nine hope is classified as "politics", understanding that it is a "civic" list and "friends". The deputy said he also did not feel any political pressure in the definition of candidates on the list: "Do you think I'm not free? I never had pressure to anything," Coutinho replied when asked about it. Backwater Present in the presentation of the list, minutes after having published the video explaining that he did not apply, Rita Santos did not want to make statements in his own name to journalists. However, the chairman of the ATFPM General Assembly confirmed that he will take over the position of advisor to the Portuguese communities. The information was also transmitted by José Pereira Coutinho, in the statements made to journalists. The withdrawal of the elections of September 14 to the Legislative Assembly is days after the prosecutor of the MSAR revealed that Rita Santos, although without revealing the name, had been questioned, at the request of the authorities of Portugal, due to investigations related to a “crime against the electoral law of Portugal in Macao”. When asked if the withdrawal was related to the investigations, both Rita Santos and José Pereira Coutinho refused any connection. The two also indicated that the possible inclusion of Rita Santos in the lists had come from Coutinho, as a "obligation" that the colleague did not want to accept. At the request of the family Regarding the option of justification to be left out of the elections, Rita Santos indicated that she departed from “a request from family members” to “spend more time with them”, mainly due to “her grandson” and the 10 brothers who complain the distance the most. "Respecting my family's desire, I will not participate in this year's Legislative Assembly elections," he said. "But, I promise to continue to support Deputy José Pereira Coutinho and also support the Public Service Workers Association and personally meet the partners. I hope you accept and respect my decision," he added. Rita Santos's participation in the legislative elections had been announced for the first time in mid -2024, at the headquarters of the Macao Public Function Association, when a visit to Macao de José Cesário, then secretary of state for the Portuguese communities. Chestless chest Regarding the New Hope list, Coutinho will be the first candidate, followed by Chan Hao Weng. Deputy Che Sa Wang was relegated to third place after being elected in 2021, when he was number two. About these changes, Coutinho indicated that Che was unable to follow the “pedaling” of legislative work. "The position of deputy is demanding. You have to intervene, you have to work, you have to handle the bills. Not everyone can keep up with the pedaling," said the legislator about the bench colleague. "My colleague is excellent co -worker, but has not been able to follow the pedaling. This is like the marathon, it is necessary to have dedication, because the projects are increasingly, complex and one person has to be prepared," he noticed. The candidate was present for a few moments in the presentation of the list, but left early. According to Coutinho, the early departure was due to a trip to Hong Kong. In addition to the three nominated candidates, the list is also made up of Chan Ka Wai, Melina Tam Leng I, Jose Miguel de Sales da Silva, Fong Im Ha, Chang Fong, Fok Chao Iu, Hung Oi Ming and Ho Sio Peng.

item.title: Big Bay | Sam Hou Fai ends in Foshan
item.description:
The chief executive returned to Macao on Tuesday night after a three-day trap for cities in the Great Bay. In the last stop, in Foshan, Sam Hou Fai suggested articulation between Foshan's Traditional Chinese Medicine Industry and Macao universities, as well as cooperation in the so -called “silver economy”
The government leader returned to Macau on Tuesday night after a three-day visit to the Great Bay cities, which culminated in Foshan, a neighboring city of the province capital, where he met with the Secretary of the Communist Party of China (CCP) Municipal Committee, Tang Yifeng. Sam Hou Fai stressed the advantages of combining Foshan's “traditional Chinese Medicine Industry, in articulation“ with the qualified staff of Macao Higher Education Institutions and the skills in scientific research ”. This level of cooperation can“ further increase the nuclear competitiveness of the respective industries of both territories, ”he said. Also at the level of care for the elderly, the two cities should establish bridges, in the perspective of the chief executive. "Given the search for the elderly of Macao to pass old age in the interior of China, the advantages of integrated services of elderly care with the health care of Foshan can be enhanced." The similarities of customs and cultural affinity between the two cities were also trumpians listed by the ruler to promote the “silver economy”. Foshan's “strong manufacturing industry” is another factor that Sam Hou Fai would like to take advantage, both at the level of industry-university-coating cooperation, combining Chinese city companies to Macao universities, and taking advantage of the role of platform from MSAR to promote Foshan products in Portuguese-speaking countries. Seven stars Prior to visiting Foshan, the chief executive passed the city plus the west of those who are part of the Great Bay project: Zhaoqing. There, Sam Hou Fai thanked the political leaders “the long -term protection commitment to the quality of the Xijiang river water, effectively ensuring drinking water safety for the population of Macao”. The leader of the Government of MSA also highlighted the role of Zhaoqing while the "only" city-car "of the Great Bay that connects the Southwest regions and also one of the important links to boost the exchange of Chinese and West cultures. It should be noted that Zhaoqing borders Guangxi province. Sam Hou Fai said that the city has a "rich cultural tradition" linked to traditional Chinese medicine, which Macao could help reach European Union markets and Lusophone countries. Zhaoqing's ecological and natural heritage was another aspect highlighted by the Chief Executive as an opportunity to form a “advantage synergy and jointly develop 'premium' routes of 'a trip with various destinations'”.

item.title: China-Portuguese | Chengdu Pavilion shows Portuguese products
item.description:
In the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion venture in Chengdu, pavilions for foreign countries and entrepreneurs who want to establish business in China are installed. Portugal is also there, represented by the Portugal Pavilion, but according to manager Ângelo Sousa, there is a lack of support from the Portuguese government and strength to combat competition
“For us there are no barriers between Portugal and China. We are 365 days here and there.” This is the way the objectives of the team that is behind the Portugal Pavilion present at the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion are presented in Chengdu and which is managed by two partners: Yinhui Tui and Ângelo Freitas de Sousa. The two realized that the Shanghai zone had reached a saturation point in the trade of products and that it was necessary to go more to the interior of the country to try to sell things as Portuguese as wine, cod or olive oil. HM talked to Yinhui Tui about this project on the sidelines of a lunch in Lisbon by the Friends of the New Seda Route Association, chaired by Fernanda Ilhéu. The event served precisely for Yinhui Tui to present the objectives of the Portugal Pavilion and try to capture business interests. “This is a very important market for Portuguese products. In China we have separated the country [in commercial terms] in four markets. We have the region of Beijing and Shanghai, which we call 'Yangtze River Economic Zone', and 'Pearl River Economic Zone'. The fourth zone is composed by the cities of Chengdu and Chongqing and which is a new economic area established in 2020. Portuguese have a lot of potential in these markets, ”he said. The businessman recalls that the marketing of Portuguese products is still below what is done by French, Spanish or other countries, but when the Chinese buyer discovers wine or olive oil, he is surprised. "In Shanghai, for example, some customers already have their opinion on French or Australians. But many think that Portuguese products have more quality," said Yinhui Tui, noting that in the area where the Portugal Pavilion operates in Sichuan province, "people are a little more conservative and prefer to try, prove and feel before buying." "Our pavilion is next to the French pavilion and we often see customers to opt for French wine. But when they go through our pavilion, they see our brands and ask what we have. When they realize that we have cheaper wine compared to French, they are surprised and say it is better, and then buy." This responsible explains that the population in the fourth economic zone is 130 million people, much more than the number of people living in the Iberian Peninsula. "Then I think it's a market with a lot of potential," he said. The Role of Lusosino Yinhui Tui and Ângelo Freitas de Sousa created Lusosino that it acts as the managing entity of the pavilion, which was born “with the intention of promoting Portuguese products in the Great Market of China”. Thus, there is a “showroom” of very Portuguese products, representing some brands known as is the case of Vieira crackers, Esporão wine, Sal Marnoto, the Prisca jams or Vista Alegre, among others. It is in this pavilion that "exhibitors display the best products, buyers discover trends and where they both find the conditions to realize business." Moreover, Lusosino, through this pavilion, helps Portuguese entrepreneurs in marketing campaigns and in the best way to contact potential Chinese customers. Specifically, Lusosino promises to perform “producer and brands records, commercial representation, market analysis, market support and preparation, among other services”, reads on the website. However, and according to Ângelo Freitas de Sousa to HM, there are many obstacles to putting Portuguese products in China. “[The Chengdu and Chongqing zone] has the advantage of being a growing market that is not overloaded with exporters and has no addictions as happens in the Shanghai zone. It is a very large market and where there are many producers.” By addictions, the entrepreneur refers to “competition” from other countries and buying habits of Chinese customers, who are faster looking for products from other nationalities than from Portugal. "There are habits of certain brands that are implemented and people don't even look at others or experience them." The Portuguese Pavilion project began with an idea of ​​Ângelo Ferreira de Sousa, who has a Chinese wife who helps him in the business. “I met Yinhui Tui, he liked Portuguese products, we got friends and then we ended up gathering energy,” he said, explaining that the interior of the country is still knowing foreign products, not just Portuguese. "The Shanghai zone has nowhere to grow and this is a growing economic zone. There are many factories that are moving to Chengdu, so there will be more development," he said. Absence of marketing The Portuguese entrepreneur regrets that the Portuguese authorities have given little support to the project, except for any follow -up by AICEP - Agency for Investment and Foreign Trade of Portugal. "All the investment was made by us and we have not had a lot of support. We had some help from AICEP, but nothing special. We do fairs, the showrooms, to prove and know our products in major cities," said Angelo Ferreira de Sousa. The entrepreneur also regrets that, despite the relationship of hundreds of years between Portugal and China, there is still flaws in the commercial strategy for the export of Portuguese products in the country. "The Spaniards are much further ahead than us," he said. Regarding the role of Macao as a platform, the entrepreneur says it is equally difficult to bring products from Portugal to China or Macau to China, due to lack of customs agreements and little flexibility. "It is not because we call Macau that I can, for example, putting sausages, cod or preserves in China, or other Portuguese products. To pass from Portugal to Macau is easy, but it is no longer so easy to take after Portuguese products from Macau to China. We have not been able to do much through Macau, but we have not sought much," he said. At the presentation in Lisbon, Yinhui Tui advanced some figures behind the construction of the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion, and help to understand their size: about 70 billion euros of investment and a space of 300,000 cubic meters. The Portugal Pavilion does not only do contact sessions or fairs: if a businessman wants to leave tons of products there, he can do so. Then the pavilion is in charge of distribution through several areas of China. “In the southern market, closer to Macao, there is a lot of competition in some areas, so it should be betting inside China,” said Yinhui Tui, referring to the potential and factor novelty that exists in some areas of the country regarding commerce.

item.title: Hold on to Hope | OIL PAINTING TO SEE IN JULY
item.description:
July marks the inauguration of a new show on Coloane Island, namely in the Hold on To Hope Gallery, managed by the Macao Toxicodeperit Rehabilitation Association. This time, the public can see oil painted paintings by six artists, in a show entitled “Chasing Dreams Under The Stars”
July 6 marks the premiere of a new exhibition with works by students of the Master Course at the University of Huaqiao, China. The show, entitled “Chasing Dreams Under the Stars”, is welcomed by the Hold on To Hope Gallery, located in the village of Ka-Hó, in Coloane. The space is managed by the artm-Macao toxicode rehabilitation Association, which is a project with a strong social integration, making known to society the work developed by this entity. The show can be visited until July 27. The six artists, master students, who present their artistic skills are Maruko, John U, Fong Hio Wa, Rosa, Madonna, Ho Cheng wa. These present, according to a press release, 30 more works of art, which reflect “individual experiences and perspectives”, as well as “thoughts and feelings about the world around”, where there is no lack of portraits of Macau and his heritage. Thus, the new show of the Hold on To Hope Gallery features “a diversity of styles and themes”, reflecting “varied creative techniques and inspirations, telling stories of hope, dreams and the pursuit of passion through works”. The organization of the show expects the public to “be captivated by the colors and techniques of each painting”. Dreams and Stars For the organization, "Chasing Dreams Under the Stars" is "more than an art exhibition", and the "celebration of creativity and power of self -expression", allowing "art and emotions to meet, transforming dreams into reality." The last exhibition held in the historic village of Ka-Hó took place in May and aimed precisely to celebrate the 25th anniversary of the Arth as a entity that helps people with the drug addiction, alcohol or game to heal and again have a life in society. With the name “Ageing Gracefully”, this show featured paintings and handicrafts produced by artm users, being considered “vital elements of daily life in the therapeutic community of the artm”.

item.title: Hong Kong | Justice evaluates appeal by journalist convicted of sedition
item.description: Hong Kong's court will analyze in September a appeal by the first journalist sentenced to the prison sentence under a law of sedition, the region's press advanced yesterday. According to the Hong Kong Free Press news portal, the Court of Appeal marked the hearing requested by Patrick Lam Shiu-Tung, former Stand News' interim writing head. The Stand News News Portal closed doors in December 2021 after a police operation involving 200 police, the company's freezing and the detention of the board, including Patrick Lam. Last October, Lam filed an appeal of the conviction, a month earlier, to 14 months in prison, the first sentence against a journalist under an established sedition law when Hong Kong was an ancient British colony. Although the first instance considered Lam guilty, the chief of writing came out of freedom due to health issues and for already fulfilling 10 months in custody. Also in September, the same court sentenced the former Stand News' chief of writing, Chung Pui-kuen, 21 months in prison by sedition. Judge Kwok Wai-Kin considered Chung and conspiracy culprits for publishing and reproducing seditious materials, along with Best Pencil (Hong Kong) Ltd, the company that owned Stand News. The trial, which began in October 2022, lasted about 50 days, and the verdict was postponed several times.

item.title: Arbitration | Signed new SINO-LUSOPHONE AGREEMENT
item.description: A new cooperation agreement in the area of ​​legal arbitration was signed, namely between the Macao World Trade Center Arbitration Center, operating at the World Trade Center, and the Institute for Certification and Training of Lusophone Mediators. According to a WTC statement, it is an agreement that aims to “improve the professionalism of mediation services and optimize efficiency in resolving transfrontic conflicts”. The memorandum was signed by Jackson Tui, president of the WTC Arbitration Center, and Ana Coimbra Trigo, president of the Certification Institute in Macao. In his speech, Jackson Tsui said that this agreement reinforces "even more the role of Macao as a binding bridge in the Sino-Lusophone legal cooperation." Ana Coimbra Trigo, on the other hand, stated that this partnership intends to “promote mutual recognition and interoperability of syno-slypone mediation standards, consolidating the role of Macao as a 'conflict resolution center between China and Lusophone countries'”.

item.description: The Iranian Parliament yesterday voted to suspend cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency following 12-day war marked by Israeli and Americans attacks against Iran's nuclear facilities. Iranian Parliament President Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf said the International Atomic Energy Agency (AIEA) refused to condemn the attack on Iranian nuclear facilities, compromising the international credibility of the United Nations. Ghalibaf's statements occurred after the deputies voted in favor of the suspension of cooperation with AIEA. "The Iranian organization of atomic energy will suspend cooperation with AIEA while the safety of nuclear facilities is not guaranteed," added the president of Parliament of Teerão. On June 13, Israel, with the support of the United States, attacked Iranian military and nuclear facilities. Iran retaliated firing missiles and launching unmanned air appliances against Israel. The ceasefire was agreed on Tuesday, after intervention by the US Administration.
