item.title: Coloane | Filipe Afonso launches work that highlights the importance of staff houses
item.description:
The latest book by Filipe Afonso, coordinator of the Architecture course at the University of São José, looks at a housing model at risk of disappearing, but can be seen in Coloane, or in old fishing zones of Hong Kong. “Coloane Grammar” presents alternative solutions for the reuse of these houses and their classification as a heritage
Taking the idea of ​​grammar that names the book, what are the main terms or concepts around Coloane, its tradition and preservation that can enumerate? The “grammar” of the book introduces the concept of vernacular architecture, which reflects the knowledge of the informal, local construction and the maritime identity of this Coloane community. It addresses the assets at risk, proposing a method of cataloging existing houses, this digital method, which establishes a dialogue between tradition and modernity to preserve this cultural landscape. What concrete proposals are suggested in the book for the protection and preservation of Coloane's stilts? The book proposes (indirectly) the classification of stilts as a heritage to give them legal protection. By cataloging existing stilts, the book contributes to preserving the memory of this type of architecture and a broader discussion about its possible protection. How could we reuse the stilts taking into account these specific ways of life and the economic diversification that the government wants to achieve? The stilts could be reused for experience tourism, or centers of cultural interpretation, valuing local history. They can be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the water line, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification. Why approach Coloane and the stilts? How did this project come about? Coloane and the stilts were approached by their architectural and cultural uniqueness, representing a threatened memory and identity of Macao. This assets at risk has a significant potential. The project also emerged from the gap of scientific knowledge about these structures and the urgent need for documentation, consolidating itself as an academic-scientific investigation. In the Asian or Southeast Asian context, are the coloane stilts or not unique in architectural terms? Water constructions are common in various Asian countries, Coloane's stilts are not a unique case in terms of existence. See the example, in Hong Kong, of the well-known Tai o village, but are unique in their specific context. Its architecture is the reflection of local regional influences and materials, adapted to the history of the evolution of Colona's fishing community and the development of Macao. Its value lies in its particular architectural language and its persistence in a rapidly transformed urban environment. What is the story behind the emergence of stilts? Are you associated with Coloane piracy reports, for example, which refer to the early twentieth century? The stilts emerged as a practical and functional solution to the sea -related way of life, allowing sea access, tidal protection and efficient use of space in coastal areas. Piracy reports in Coloane were not the direct cause of their emergence. Shapes are essentially the response of an informal architecture of local communities to adapt to the maritime environment. Museum Idea on Coloane Stop Stand since 2017 The need for preservation of coloane stilts is not a recent idea. Between 2017 and 2018, the Directorate of Tourism Services proposed the creation of a museum entirely dedicated to the stories of these dwellings arranged in Rua dos Navegantes, but the project was being postponed for legal reasons. In 2018, the Tribuna de Macao newspaper (JTM) published an article where it referred precisely the absence of “legal foundations” for the construction of new infrastructure in the Maritime area of ​​Macao, something that has changed, however, given that the MSAR passed, from 2018, to include in its jurisdiction the management of 85 square kilometers of maritime zones. Last year alone, the executive's plans for the creation of a “functional maritime zoning”, “maritime areas” and other related laws, and a concrete decision on what will be made on what will be made on the stilts. Both zoning and plan will be defined for a temporal period by 2040. One of the objectives of the executive is environmental and ecological preservation, as well as certain experiences of the population. One of the points of the public consultation report speaks of “optimizing ocean exploration modalities according to Macau's development needs; coordinating the use of sea in production, daily life of the population and ecology” and performing “intensive and economizers uses to realize the rational allocation of maritime resources”. In 2018, according to the JTM, STD assured that it would be necessary to “wait for the publication of the maritime area and administrative regulation on the administration of the use of maritime zones” and only then could you think of the planning of the museum. HM questioned STD of this article, and until the closing of this edition, obtained new clarifications. A gradual development In a master's dissertation in architecture, defended in 2023 at the University of Coimbra, Ana Rita Rodrigues made the study of the “Evolution of Macao Territory-Aterros and Urban Design in the Taipa and Coloane islands”, and concluded that “Portuguese occupation in the islands of Taipa and Coloane brought improvements in infrastructure, safety and village organization”. In the late nineteenth century, "there were already, in the islands, schools, hospitals and basic infrastructure, promoting the economic growth of the region." Referring to the existence of stilts “used for the construction of fishing and housing boats for fishermen, naturally facing the river”, in a coloane zone composed “by precarious housing of one or two floors, unlike the type of common housing found in mud or macao, which was more focused on high development”. The author also points out that “development was slower” in Coloane, as well as the absence, on both islands, of “a unified general plan and the need for better urban planning to ensure a cohesive and sustainable environment”.

item.title: Teaching | I was entering local schools, but resources are scarce
item.description:
The government has been betting on the introduction of artificial intelligence in territory schools, but with a few hours in the curriculum. In addition, schools complain of few resources to meet government goals
Macao schools have integrated artificial intelligence tools (AI) in classrooms, such as smart paintings and linguistic models, but some teachers warn that most are not prepared to comply with outlined policy for the sector. After classes, students at Pui Va Secondary School remain in the classroom, distracted to explore a smart condition. These staff - explains Ruan Zhan Teng, school teacher at the school - act as interactive projectors and are used as soon as the first year, to write, watch videos or participate in classes with digital media. "In the third year, students begin to learn to identify artificial intelligence in everyday life, basic programming and photos and videos generated by AI," the computer teacher added to Lusa. The change took place in 2024 and is stipulated in the law: AI should be included in primary education (with a workload of 17 hours and 20 minutes per year), from 7th to 9th grade (19 hours and 20 minutes) and from 10th to 12th (18 hours and 40 minutes). Despite the requirement, Andy Chun Wai Fan, professor and director of the University of Macao Information and Communication Center in Education, Note that schools face two obstacles: lack of resources and faculty formation. “Some schools have only one information technology teacher,” said Fan, also referring that institutions generally have computer classes only once a week. Do not update Pedro Lobo, a teacher in this area, with 30 years of experience in the territory, including at the Portuguese School of Macau, is concerned about the lack of training. "Most teachers are already a certain age, they have not grown with this new technology ... So the mindset is still short of all this evolution, and change is being so fast that it can hardly follow," explained the Portuguese. Education authorities require teachers 30 hours of annual IA training, however, Pedro Lobo considers not sufficient. Although this year has already studied almost 40 hours, the teacher says he is "little prepared". Regarding this government policy, Andy Chun Wai Fan also remembers that it is required to schools that address ethics, innovation and collaboration in the domain of AI, although it fits the institutions the creation of the manuals themselves. “We do not have a manual about what to teach (…), each school has its own ideas about what to do with its students,” wolf reacted, explaining that he teaches “transferring AI to school work”, either through image generation, small game development, AI ethics approach and copyright issues. Since 2021 at PUI VA In a different record, the Pui Va Secondary School, which introduced AI in 2021, assumes to be “well prepared” to “the change”. The institution spends about two million patacas a year on AI tools, employs seven information technology teachers (IT) and hired a university professor in Beijing to support. “We want students to be able to use artificial intelligence to identify problems and solve real -life problems,” noticed the IT Office Director of Chinese educational establishment, Chong Wai Yin. Here, students work, for example, with programming languages ​​(Python, Tencent, Iflytek), and AI models such as Deepseek and ChatgPT, engaging in intelligent city projects, in the first cycle, and in the creation of applications, at a later stage, said Zhao Qihao, former professor at the University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, who taught in Puija VA. “In the first cycle, we developed smart cities, automated houses and AI -powered parking systems (…). In the second cycle, students create mobile applications and sustainable technological projects,” he explained. In April, the Secretary for Social Affairs and Culture, LAM, announced that Macao's educational reforms for 2025 will focus on AI and include plans for an intelligent classroom in all schools. The Government of Macao attributed to the school network under the direction of the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) 15 million PATACA for AI software for this academic year. In an email sent to Lusa, DSEDJ stated that the government “attributes great importance” to the teaching of information technologies. "The medium and long term plan for non-higher education (2021-2030) identified 'reinforcement of creativity and technological education' as one of the main directions of development," he explains in the note. However, Pedro Lobo questions the pressure on young students: "Are we seeing children 8, 9, 10 years old to develop applications? Maybe 1 percent is capable. The rest does the best they can. They have classes and homework that never end." Concerned deputies In the last debate of the Legislative Assembly, last Thursday, two deputies, Iau Teng Pio and Kou Kam Fai, linked to education, defended the need for “high quality development of education in Macao”, namely with the bet on AI. One of the suggestions, referred to during the interventions before the order of day, was the reinforcement of the “coordinated development mechanism between education, scientific and technological innovation and talents”, with the increase of “Stem resources [science, technology, engineering and mathematics] and artificial intelligence on basic education, rooting the basis of scientific literacy”. In the debate on the 11th of this month, deputy Ma Io Fong appealed to the AI ​​regulation to avoid scams, but also to increase the awareness of society in relation to this new reality. “With the rapid development of technology these days, the use of AI functions is gradually becoming important help for society and residents in daily life and work. However, AI can give rise to illicit acts, especially the worsening cyber attacks and the diffusion of false information.” Also during the interventions before the agenda, the deputy asked the executive to “reinforce sensitization and education on the prevention of AI fraud, to raise the elderly and young people, emphasizing that the dissemination of false videos generated by AI can be a legal offense with serious consequences”. In this context, the systematic integration of “AI safety knowledge in school curricula and the realization of different awareness and education activities with community associations was requested to increase public knowledge about AI technology and the risk derived for its abuse”. "It is also due, through cooperation between the government, society, schools and the family, to reinforce the ability to respond to information and the internet discourse, allowing to react, clarify and follow up on useful time, when the public faces information that can cause negative influences or be misleading," said Ma Io Fong in the 11th debate.

item.title: History | The MA-chan escape to the colonial and macau
item.description:
The MA-chan family is from Mozambique with Chinese roots, sought its new path in the then colonial Portugal and since 1976 that set roots in Macao. José Manuel Machon, resident in the territory since he was 13, told Lusa the very peculiar trajectory of his family, which reflects many of the family directions taken in the years of war and the end of the Portuguese colonial empire
The MA-chan, the Mozambican family with roots in China, fled twice to communism and twice resumed in colonial Portugal. In 1976, they landed in Macao, where Mozambique's memory had erased with the departure of the Landins, African troops that parked in the territory for decades since 1912. According to a report by Luís Andrade de Sá published in Macau magazine in 1992, and quoted by the blog "Chronicles Macanese", the Landins were in Macao "for about five decades", and "the Chinese never used to their conviviality, suspiciously who had the huge blacks who played a horrible drumsticks while returning the ostensiva. ferocity ”. The term Landim became a reference “to identify all indigenous battalions that passed by Macau”, is described in the same report. Massá Ma-chan went in 1963 to the Namphlam, northern Mozambique Conservatory to register the fifth son, but once again denied this Chinese, with roots in Guangzhou, the transmission of the nickname to descent. José Manuel was the same as his brothers: the nickname Machon, corruption of MA-chan. The identity of José Manuel Machon, embryoly marked by this bureaucratic detail imposed by the then Portuguese Mozambique, is not only a reflection of the colonial past of Portugal, but from the beginnings of Sino-Mozambican relations. “I don't have great confusion, I tried to adapt to life,” he tells Lusa in Macau, where he has lived since he was 13. The grandfather-also MA-chan-was the one who defined that this story began in Africa, leaving China looking for better life, in the starter of the twentieth century, and settling in Nampula, alongside Sharing, a Macua woman, Mozambican ethnic group. Massá, the son -and father of José Manuel -was sent to Guangzhou at 14, to receive formal education there. When he returns to Mozambique, he is a married man with a bullet mark near his left shoulder. In China, he faced the Japanese in World War II and married a Chinese, which he met on the day of marriage, until, on the threshold of the civil war, which would victory to Mao Zedong's communists, fled. He dedicated himself to Nampula to the cucumber of the cucumber-the 'Magojojo'-and the tubar bit, which he exported to Hong Kong. The Great Return However, unable to adapt, the woman returned to Macao with her four children, where she died. Massá returned to marry, this time with a Mozambican - José Manuel came first, Carla later. When the Frelimo flag raised on the mast in Mozambique on June 25, 1975, the MA-chan-headed Macao, with a brief passage in Portugal, where they inhabited a pension paid by the then IARN. “We are nothing returned, because we have not returned anywhere, we are refugees,” says Carla Machon, residing in Portugal. “When my father heard again about communism, he fled,” says his brother, José Manuel. While speaking, bowling balls pack on the floor and travel the track to a new crash. The noise in the center of Bowling Future Bright does not seem to bother this big man, 61, fluent in Cantonese and Portuguese and president of Macao Bowling Club. “This is what keeps me stable. Instead of going to the glasses, I come here,” he notes. For Joseph, independence "it was an open openness, an opening to the world." It doesn't even talk about political reasons, but how important it was to cross half a world until you arrived in Macau. A new life In this page turn, the MA-chan/maachon family came to find, in 1976, a city with little civil presence abroad. José and Carla do not remember other Mozambicans, who began to arrive after independence, many from Portugal. Mong-Há's fortress is an old witness to Mozambique's presence in Macau. Then the Landins, Mozambican soldiers at the service of the Colonial Army were quartered, recalls journalist João Guedes, a scholar in the history of Macao. It is this historical circumstance that baptized the hill of Mong-há of “Mountain of Black Ghosts”. These troops, with the “greatest warrior instinct”, in the expression of Emperor Gungunhana, remained in Macao half a century, until around the 1960s. They were responsible, for example, by the storage of the siege gates, border of the territory with China and recurring incident place. “They passed by and faded as if they had never been,” resumes Guedes, indicating that there was no material heritage attesting this military presence. Not far from Mong-Há, but at the Riquexó restaurant, troops are still there, eternalized in photos hanging on the walls. This serves African chicken, macanese dish, whose origin is still today the target of debate. Two theories: It was created by the Portuguese chief Américo Ângelo, inspired by a trip to Mozambique. Another version realizes that, seeing the African soldiers missing roasted chicken, Americo made the dish. And the memory of macau-moca-mandamous relationships is not complete without evoking the trafficking in leaf. If, on the one hand, it is known that the Portuguese took slaves from the African colonies by settling in the doors of China, in reverse, were also sent via Macao, Chinese to work in Mozambique, often in slavery conditions. The sons were part of a migratory movement from the late nineteenth century, “to develop the Mozambican colony,” explains the professor at Joaquim Chissano University in Maputo, Fatima Papelo, who investigates Sino-Mozambican cooperation. The first group, he says, was sent in 1858 and "consisted of 30 men." More than a century later, in the struggle for Mozambican independence, Beijing supported the Liberation Front of Mozambique (Frelimo) and is one of the first countries to recognize the new sovereign state. In Macao, the reinforcement of the ties was later paid, with the transition from the territory of Portugal to China in 1999. But for José Manuel, Mozambique was always present. The last time it went, tells, visited and cleaned the family campaign, "there at Machamba". "It's a Chinese custom," he explained.

item.title: China-Portuguese | Chengdu Pavilion shows Portuguese products
item.description:
In the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion venture in Chengdu, pavilions for foreign countries and entrepreneurs who want to establish business in China are installed. Portugal is also there, represented by the Portugal Pavilion, but according to manager Ângelo Sousa, there is a lack of support from the Portuguese government and strength to combat competition
“For us there are no barriers between Portugal and China. We are 365 days here and there.” This is the way the objectives of the team that is behind the Portugal Pavilion present at the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion are presented in Chengdu and which is managed by two partners: Yinhui Tui and Ângelo Freitas de Sousa. The two realized that the Shanghai zone had reached a saturation point in the trade of products and that it was necessary to go more to the interior of the country to try to sell things as Portuguese as wine, cod or olive oil. HM talked to Yinhui Tui about this project on the sidelines of a lunch in Lisbon by the Friends of the New Seda Route Association, chaired by Fernanda Ilhéu. The event served precisely for Yinhui Tui to present the objectives of the Portugal Pavilion and try to capture business interests. “This is a very important market for Portuguese products. In China we have separated the country [in commercial terms] in four markets. We have the region of Beijing and Shanghai, which we call 'Yangtze River Economic Zone', and 'Pearl River Economic Zone'. The fourth zone is composed by the cities of Chengdu and Chongqing and which is a new economic area established in 2020. Portuguese have a lot of potential in these markets, ”he said. The businessman recalls that the marketing of Portuguese products is still below what is done by French, Spanish or other countries, but when the Chinese buyer discovers wine or olive oil, he is surprised. "In Shanghai, for example, some customers already have their opinion on French or Australians. But many think that Portuguese products have more quality," said Yinhui Tui, noting that in the area where the Portugal Pavilion operates in Sichuan province, "people are a little more conservative and prefer to try, prove and feel before buying." "Our pavilion is next to the French pavilion and we often see customers to opt for French wine. But when they go through our pavilion, they see our brands and ask what we have. When they realize that we have cheaper wine compared to French, they are surprised and say it is better, and then buy." This responsible explains that the population in the fourth economic zone is 130 million people, much more than the number of people living in the Iberian Peninsula. "Then I think it's a market with a lot of potential," he said. The Role of Lusosino Yinhui Tui and Ângelo Freitas de Sousa created Lusosino that it acts as the managing entity of the pavilion, which was born “with the intention of promoting Portuguese products in the Great Market of China”. Thus, there is a “showroom” of very Portuguese products, representing some brands known as is the case of Vieira crackers, Esporão wine, Sal Marnoto, the Prisca jams or Vista Alegre, among others. It is in this pavilion that "exhibitors display the best products, buyers discover trends and where they both find the conditions to realize business." Moreover, Lusosino, through this pavilion, helps Portuguese entrepreneurs in marketing campaigns and in the best way to contact potential Chinese customers. Specifically, Lusosino promises to perform “producer and brands records, commercial representation, market analysis, market support and preparation, among other services”, reads on the website. However, and according to Ângelo Freitas de Sousa to HM, there are many obstacles to putting Portuguese products in China. “[The Chengdu and Chongqing zone] has the advantage of being a growing market that is not overloaded with exporters and has no addictions as happens in the Shanghai zone. It is a very large market and where there are many producers.” By addictions, the entrepreneur refers to “competition” from other countries and buying habits of Chinese customers, who are faster looking for products from other nationalities than from Portugal. "There are habits of certain brands that are implemented and people don't even look at others or experience them." The Portuguese Pavilion project began with an idea of ​​Ângelo Ferreira de Sousa, who has a Chinese wife who helps him in the business. “I met Yinhui Tui, he liked Portuguese products, we got friends and then we ended up gathering energy,” he said, explaining that the interior of the country is still knowing foreign products, not just Portuguese. "The Shanghai zone has nowhere to grow and this is a growing economic zone. There are many factories that are moving to Chengdu, so there will be more development," he said. Absence of marketing The Portuguese entrepreneur regrets that the Portuguese authorities have given little support to the project, except for any follow -up by AICEP - Agency for Investment and Foreign Trade of Portugal. "All the investment was made by us and we have not had a lot of support. We had some help from AICEP, but nothing special. We do fairs, the showrooms, to prove and know our products in major cities," said Angelo Ferreira de Sousa. The entrepreneur also regrets that, despite the relationship of hundreds of years between Portugal and China, there is still flaws in the commercial strategy for the export of Portuguese products in the country. "The Spaniards are much further ahead than us," he said. Regarding the role of Macao as a platform, the entrepreneur says it is equally difficult to bring products from Portugal to China or Macau to China, due to lack of customs agreements and little flexibility. "It is not because we call Macau that I can, for example, putting sausages, cod or preserves in China, or other Portuguese products. To pass from Portugal to Macau is easy, but it is no longer so easy to take after Portuguese products from Macau to China. We have not been able to do much through Macau, but we have not sought much," he said. At the presentation in Lisbon, Yinhui Tui advanced some figures behind the construction of the Euro-Asia National Commodity Pavillion, and help to understand their size: about 70 billion euros of investment and a space of 300,000 cubic meters. The Portugal Pavilion does not only do contact sessions or fairs: if a businessman wants to leave tons of products there, he can do so. Then the pavilion is in charge of distribution through several areas of China. “In the southern market, closer to Macao, there is a lot of competition in some areas, so it should be bet on the interior of China,” said Yinhui Tui, referring to the potential and factor novelty that exists in some areas of the country regarding commerce.

item.title: Elections | “Soldier of Mao” claims innocent and says he was six days unable to take a shower
item.description:
Accused of electoral corruption and having an illegal Mahjong business, Wong Wai Man yesterday returned to the load to cry out his innocence. The president of the Iron and Steel Shipowners Association says he was “provoked” to climb to the roof where he was a few hours, and was six days without being able to bathe or change clothes
The panorama of the legislative elections for the hemicycle already boils. In addition to these elections with the smallest number of candidate lists since the creation of the MSAR, the controversy is installed with the almost candidate Wong Wai Man, who tried to submit his candidacy without success. Also known as the “Soldier of Mao” and “Captain of Macao”, and after being accused of electoral corruption and having an illegal Mahjong business, behold, Wong Wai Man returned to the cargo to explain: refuses the accusations that he is targeted, says he was persecuted by the authorities and refers to “torture” the way he was treated when his detention. The president of the Iron and Steel Association was on Monday, several hours on a roof of a house made with a metal plate in the mud, having been rescued by the Fire Department. A solution that says it was “provoked” after being detained by the Judiciary Police (PJ), referred to the Public Prosecution Service and receiving the Commissioner's Call against Corruption (CCAC), which accuses him of having the illegal business. Wong Wai Man explained that, shortly after leaving the CCAC Office in the Nape area, he was intercepted by an employee of this body that alleged the lack of signature in some documents. However, not satisfied with the situation, Wong Wai Man picked up a taxi towards the mud, eventually taking refuge on the roof. "I had no other option, CCAC wanted to chase me to death. So I was on the roof," he explained. Regarding accusations of electoral corruption, man says he is poor and is unable to commit such illegalities. Regarding Mahjong's alleged illegal business, Wong Wai Man stressed that the Association's headquarters in fact has Mahjong tables, but only for the enjoyment of the partners. Regarding the use of money in these games, Wong Wai Man said there was always a sign to say that it was forbidden to be bets on money and that there was, at the association's headquarters, a box for donations, but that was intended for voluntary support of the partners to help the association's operation. This is because, according to this, besides being president is also the only one to support all expenses of the Association of Iron and Steel shipowners, namely those related to income, water and light, considering that since 2014 that the entity has not received subsidies. One thing is certain: the association's headquarters will close doors tomorrow due to the end of the lease. Wong Wai Man says that for now, he will not look for a new address for the association because, for now, he has a more pressing subject: looking for a place to live. Wong Wai Man made the association's headquarters to his home. Life lesson Despite having missed the opportunity to submit a list and be a candidate for elections for the Legislative Assembly by Via Direct, Wong Wai Man argued that the most important thing was to participate in the whole process and learn new things. The "captain of Macao" also said that he is dedicated to society of heart and not by selfishness. Your ideal is to do things justly for society, since it argues that traditional associations do not defend the people. Wong Wai Man also told journalists a personal episode to justify their participation in social and public causes. "In 2007 my wife was pregnant and the hospitals convinced her to end her pregnancy because the baby's survival rate would be 50 percent, due to the fact that a fetal anomaly was detected after the exams. I insisted and the government eventually paid the operation worth 70 thousand patacas. So I want to make my contribution to repay a favor" to heaven "," he said. Six days without bathing According to the All About Macau newspaper, Wong Wai Man reported that he was still six days without bathing and sleeping, having remained a week missing until he performed with CCAC this Monday. Before he did, he said he was a total of six days detained, which for himself was “torture”, and that in total was all this time without bathing, sleeping or changing clothes. On Sunday, you will have been able to go home. “Last night [Tuesday] I was finally able to sleep well and shower. I was six days without being able to bathe or change my clothes,” he explained. The climb to the roof of the house in the mud was also a form of protest by the way it was treated, he said. The detention took place at dawn last Wednesday, the 11th, between 3 am and 4 am, with the argument that Wong Wai Man would maintain an illegal Mahjong business. It was then that he was detained for 48 hours in a squad in the mud, and was then transferred to the Public Prosecution Service (MP) to continue to make statements. After this process, he was notified to present himself with CCAC, having signed the requested documents. He was then arrested again for another 48 hours and transferred again to the MP. When, already on the street, he was again informed that he would have to return to CCAC to sign more documents, decided to escape and take refuge on the roof.

item.title: Breast Cancer | Research of one does “revolutionary discovery”
item.description:
A study by a team led by two professors at the University of Macao seeks answers to combat breast cancer. Academics concluded that cancer cells spread mainly through the lymphatic system, not by the bloodstream
“The lymphatic system is the main route for breast cancer dissemination and metastasis, revealed by tracking unique cell lineage” is a scientific article that seeks to increase knowledge that allows you to find solutions to the disease. The work was developed by a research team led by the full professor Chuxia Deng and assistant professor Miao Kai at the University of Macao Faculty of Health Sciences (one) and, according to a note from UM, is a “revolutionary discovery in the study of cancer metastases”. Thus, and for the first time, “a qualitative and quantitative analysis of the machine cancer metastases was made, and was applied by scientists“ a barcode system based on a unique cell lineage tracking approach ”called Celltag. With this method, results were obtained that reveal that "cancer cells spread mainly through the lymphatic system, not by the bloodstream." In addition, he points out one, “research also found that interaction between tumor cells and the tumor microenvironment (TME) determines the metastatic potential of cancer cells”, ie whether or not they may easily reproduce. In this sense, “the study systematically demonstrates the roads of tumor metastases and opens new ways for the development of cancer treatment strategies”, is described. The article was published in the magazine “Molecular Cancer” and is the result of an investigation by a vast team, consisting of Kai Miao, Aiping Zhang, Xiaodan Yang, Yipeng Zhang, Anqi Lin, Lijian Wang, Xin Zhang, Heng Sun, Jun Xu, Yuzhao Feng, Fangyuan Shao, Sen Guo, Zhihui Weng, Peng Luo, Xiaoling Xu and Ch -xia Deng. Highlight for the collaboration of scientists from other higher education institutions in the region, such as Aiping Zhang, Hong Kong-Shenzhen Hospital University, and Jingyao Zhang and Shuai Gao, linked to China Agricultural University in Beijing. In turn, Dong Wang and Xiao-Yang Zhao are linked to Southern Medical University's School of Basic Medical Sciences in Guangzhou. Microenvironment is an important factor One explains, in the same statement, that the study in question “provides empirical evidence for route preference in cancer metastasis”, demonstrating that tumor cells are “pre-programmed” with “intrinsic information that determine their metastatic potential”, and these cells “adapt dynamically their genetic expression based on the target organs”. Thus, "these findings establish the foundations for the development of therapies directed to lymphatic metastasis, such as inhibition of cytokine signaling or interruption of communication between tumor and stroma to suppress metastasis." In the investigation, the “single cell RNA sequencing technology” was used, which allowed the team to “discover that genetically identical tumor cells exhibit profiles of specific genetic expression of the organ”, so the microenvironment proves to be “fundamental in the formation of tumor cell behavior”. "For example, pulmonary metastatic cells positively regulate oxidative stress -related genes, while hepatic metastatic cells activate metabolic regulatory pathways," is referred to. The danger of metastases One points out that, in cancer diseases, metastases are the main cause of death. However, to date, "the mechanisms that govern the selection of the route" of these same metastases remained "obscure." “Using Celltag technology, the research team traced the spread of breast cancer cells on mice models,” discovered that “less than 3 percent of cancer cells spread throughout the bloodstream, while more than 80 percent metasta through the lymphatic system for distant organs such as lungs and liver”. Thus, "further analysis has shown that lymph spread cells have distinct genetic expression patterns and communicate closely with stromal cells, such as endothelial fibroblasts and cells in the microenvironment, forming an adaptive" seed-solo "mechanism." Looking at the study, the authors explain that cancer metastasis “is a process in which the tumor cells of the primary tumor invade the basal membrane of the blood or lymphatic vessels (intravasation), travel the blood or lymphatic system and colonize distant organs and tissues to continue their development”. Several studies point to the fact that metastases are responsible for 70 to 90 percent of cancer -related mortality, and “the dissemination of tumor cells in the vasculature and lymphatic vessels occurs simultaneously in the vast majority of cancers”. Blood roads In the discussion of the results, the study authors say that, in general terms, “tumor cells metastatize mainly through blood circulation and lymphatic system”, and until the publication of this work had been performed “numerous studies to distinguish the role of both systems in the various phases of cancer metastasis”, without knowing “which way’ for metastasis ”. It is referred to in the article, citing other studies that “cancer cells enter the bloodstream through intravasation to become CTCs [Circulating Tumor Cells-Tumor Cells in circulation], having revealed highly correlated with the survival results of breast cancer patients”. The authors also explain that “the lymphatic system is considered critical for metastasis” because “melanoma cells with experience in the lymphatic system were more resistant to ironPtosis and formed more metastases”, and in cases of “cancer tumor resection, cancer cells can further disseminate the lymphatic ganglia for blood vessels and form tumors and forming tumors metastatic in the lungs ”. To date, “although metastatic dissemination was viable by both ways, the relative importance of each process for a certain type of cancer and the target organ was unknown due to the lack of adequate quantitative tools”, something to which this study, using the celltag system, intended to respond. Thus, "we demonstrate that most lung and liver metastatic cells can be detected in the lymphatic system rather than CTCs [circulation tumor cells] derived from the blood, indicating that the lymphatic vessels can be the favorite way for tumor cell metastasis, at least in breast cancer." The authors promise not to stop here in the discovery of the course made by the metastasis of carcinogenic cells, having already performed "preliminary tests" with some cells in order to find out the possibility of "drastic" reduction of tumor cells disseminated by lymphatic. "We will continue to work on this to deepen the lymphatic dissemination mechanism and explore therapeutic interruptions in our future efforts," he is mentioned.

item.title: Commerce | CUPPA Coffee manager calls for support to Portuguese companies
item.description:
The story of Cuppa Coffee dates back to 2008 when it was hard to find a space in Macau to drink good coffee. The location in the old mud brought fame to the project, but the space ended up closing doors and moving to Studio City. João Incarnation, who manages coffee, speaks of the news and the importance of supporting Lusophone matrix projects
It all started in the mind of Portuguese Cristiana Figueiredo, at a time when for a Portuguese or passionate about coffee living in Macau it was hard to find a space to enjoy this drink accompanied by bakery or pastry products, in good Portuguese way. Cristiana Figueiredo said, in an interview with the Macao Commerce and Investment Promotion Institute (Ipim), which led her to invest in this type of business. "In Europe, people have a habit to go to coffee and to work for work. When I came to Macau for over 20 years, I realized that the Portuguese coffee culture is not popular in Macao, so I was born the idea of ​​opening a coffee in Macao, hoping to promote the food and culture of Portuguese coffee." Since 2008, Cuppa Coffee, associated with the initial project of the businesswoman, Nata Bakery, founded in 2007 and focused on bakery and pastry products, has become one of the favorite spaces of the Portuguese, foreign and even resident of the territory. However, the direction of the economic environment, with greater difficulties in paying lace, has dictated some transformations to the project, which now ends doors to the entrance of Taipa Velha and also with Lakes Nam Van, to be only in the Studio City venture in Cotai. The closure in the lakes Nam Van took place in January. At HM, João Incarnation, director and shareholder of the company that generates Cuppa Coffee, explains that, in fact, the change to the Cotai was decided for a long time. "I often say that there was no change to Studio City, because this was a plan that already existed and that came regardless of the taipa store closure. We would always open this space regardless of whether we continue, or not, with the store in the mud, whose closure was due to a failed negotiation regarding space income." According to João Incarnation, who today generates the company with Nicole Massa Helm, both considered that "in the current economic situation there was no conditions to continue in that space, which is relatively large and had its costs." "We needed to contain if we wanted the business to continue to work, because the alternative is always to close completely. We did not give up on the idea of ​​opening anything in the mud and being a little closer to our regular and more faithful customers, so we continue to open another establishment in the mud that can serve customers who live there. So there is no trip to Studio City," João Incarnation. The director and shareholder understands that this change always causes some nostalgia. “We pity it to have closed it. It cost us, we really have a lot of pity,” he confessed. "It was a decision that could have been made longer, at least a year, but we still tried to keep the establishment there, but we were not possible. We will see what the future reserves us." Despite these changes, Cuppa Coffee can be considered a successful case. "It worked there for many years and it worked well. This is a business that has to have certain conditions to work because, as we know, it has a lot of movement, but with little performance regarding each client. It is a business that needs many customers to support themselves, and for many years, at the level of rent values ​​and everything else, suppliers, for example, was much cheaper and things worked better," he recalls. The location in Taipa Velha gave Cuppa Coffee “a very large recognition and clientele”, despite the growing difficulties. "As prices were increasing, we also needed to increase our prices, but never in proportion to the increase in expenses. There was a time when we could not continue," he assumed. What the future reserves João Incarnation ensures that what customers have always sought in this space will continue in Studio City: good coffee and pastry products, with the presence of Portugal. "We always try to introduce new products. We created a new, coffee and coconut -based drink, which is excellent. We also introduced the" Nata Bomb ", a Milkshake Beat Concept flavored Nata, a true bomb," he described. There are also “traditional Portuguese products that did not exist before, such as bay bread”, as well as the donuts with different flavors, “to complete the offer we have”. "Our offer is already so varied that, even without introducing more products, it is sufficient to satisfy the values ​​of Portuguese customers and others as well." John Incarnation also said that the change of establishment to Studio City was born from an invitation. “We don't know how to run yet, it's a bet that we are making right now”, and the goal is always to go back to street coffee. "The concept of having a neighborhood store or on the street is something that interests us a lot and we are already seeing other possibilities," he added. "I don't have enough data to tell you that the change to Studio City is a winning bet. It's different, just like the concept, and we will have another type of customers beyond the usual." A “Heart” project Looking back, John Incarnation says that, for example, major problems have never been registered with human resources. "To this day we do not feel the big problem with lack of labor, it has never been something that has greatly affected us. Nowadays it is not as easy as it used to have quotas [for non-resident workers], as there are enough places that need placement. It is able to be easier, at this time, to get more local workers than before," he said, confirming that lace remain to be the big problem for such business. “Cuppa Coffee is a project of the heart and during the pandemic I realized that I was going to close. I also realized that there was a series of closures, almost simultaneously, from other Portuguese establishments. Talk to my partner, who has a lot of experience in this area, and told him that I liked to try to keep Cuppa Coffee open. Possible to continue exactly the same concept and the same quality as it had been having with Cristiana, who did an excellent work in the creation and growth of Cuppa Coffee. ” Overcoming the pandemic years, and at a time when Macau faces a break in local consumption, João Incarnation says that "it fulfills a bit to the Portuguese community to make the possible to support the effort we do so that everything is still open." "I am not just talking about Cuppa Coffee, but also from wheat d'Ouro, butteria, Portuguese restaurants and Lord Stow, which is not a typical Portuguese business is based on Portuguese culture. All these businesses have to be fed and supported. For our part, we must maintain quality, but the Portuguese community has to take advantage of what exists and support the Portuguese business." Despite the breach of consumption by the places, João Incarnation says that a balance with the consumption of tourists is guaranteed. "We feel a little [Break of consumption], but we can counterbalance with the offers we make and that satisfy the taste of local Chinese and visitors. But of course [Breaking of Consumption] has, of course, impact on business, not just the Portuguese, and this is in the city. But I think there is still some critical mass to keep Portuguese business open," he said.

item.title: Coutinho wants direct flights between Macau and Portugal
item.description: Deputy José Pereira Coutinho defended direct flights to Portugal yesterday and warned that restrictions on annual financial aid given to the residents of the Chinese region will affect reformed in Portugal. “We have to transform Macao International Airport, in fact with direct air routes to Europe, namely to Portugal,” Coutinho said after the presentation of the political program of the Nova Esperança list to the local parliament. The jurist said the largest long -haul aircraft in the world can land in Macao, but a lack of space to park aircraft, a problem that said he expected to be solved by expanding the infrastructure. The expansion of the airport, launched in November, involves the construction of a landfill with more than 129 hectares and is expected to be over in 2030, increasing the capacity of 9.6 million to 13 million passengers per year. "We hope that in the future it is not necessary to move to Hong Kong to take an international flight to Europe or America and we can start the trip in Macao which is our home," said Coutinho. Macao airport currently has regular passenger flights operated by 27 airlines to 41 destinations in mainland China, Taiwan, Southeast Asia, Japan and South Korea. Criticized cuts On the other hand, Coutinho criticized local government's decision to restrict financial aids given annually to people with resident status to those who in 2024 resided in the region at least 183 days. The measure provides for exceptions, including for those living in nine cities of mainland China integrated in the Great Guandong-Hong Kong-Macau Bay project and those studying at universities abroad. But Coutinho warned that the exceptions did not eliminate all injustices, namely cases of retired people living in Portugal. The deputy gave the example of a former Portuguese soldier, “almost 90 years old”, who worked for 40 years as a police in Macao, but has no right to financial aid for going to live with his daughter in Portugal after being widowed. "Do you think it is fair?" Coutinho asked the journalists. The Nova Esperança political program also advocates "a deeper realization" of the role of Macao as a cooperation platform with Portuguese -speaking countries, "with the greater participation of the population and entrepreneurs." The new hope was one of eight candidacies validated by the Electoral Affairs Commission of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal). Four years ago, there were 19 lists of candidates for the Legislative Assembly, although five lists and 21 candidates -15 of which pro -democracy -were then excluded for "not defending the basic law" and not being "faithful to masters".

item.title: Light Metro | Plans disclosed for sign 8 of Typhoon

item.title: Silk Route | Talent Training Program started in Beijing
item.description: It was officially launched in Beijing, on the 16th, the talent formation program in the areas of cultural and creative design of the Seda Maritime Route, supported by MGM and selected for funding from the China National Arts Fund (FNAC) this year. In a press release, it is described how this program will be developed in collaboration with the Palace Museum and the Fashion Technology Institute, both based in Beijing. The idea is to train “an elite education team” that, for 60 days of “intensive courses and field studies”, will explore “several key points along the silk sea route”. The program, entitled “Training of Talents in Cultural and Creative Design for the Silk's Maritime Route”, aims to promote “Innovative Research and Innovative Transformation of the Cultural and Historical Heritage of the Silk Maritime Route, forming related talents, highlighting the fundamental role of Macau as a bridge between Chinese and Western cultures”. The program proposes a “multifaceted formation that combines theory, field studies and practice, with the aim of transforming participants into professionals, communicators and promoters of cultural heritage and creativity”, aiming to “cultivate new talents for the development of creative and cultural tourism industries in the great Guangdong-Hong Bay Kong-Macau, also contributing to the continuity of the silk route cultural legacy”. 30 participants were chosen, “including professionals from the cultural and arts heritage sectors, academic and doctoral researchers”, and after Beijing, the program continues in Quanzhou, Guangzhou, Hengqin and Macau, “offering distinct learning experiences”. After these face -to -face sessions, participants will enter a creative online phase to refine their work through continuous dialogue with instructors. The final results will be revealed in the first quarter of 2026, highlights MGM in a press release.

item.title: Dialogues on autism and disability until Friday
item.description: It takes place this week, and by Friday, a new edition of the “Inclusion” festival, which aims to alert participants to the needs of people with autism spectrum, with disabilities and special educational needs. item.title: Academy announces cinema support candidates until July 20
item.description: The applications and submission of projects for the “International Film Camp” initiative (IFC, in the English), promoted by the Asian Academy of Cinema Awards and supported by Sands China. item.title: Arbitration | Signed new SINO-LUSOPHONE AGREEMENT

item.title: Financial Reserve | Registered higher value since 2021
item.description:
Macao's financial reserve assets reached 632.6 billion Patacas at the end of April, the highest value since the end of 2021. In the first four months of 2025, the reserve grew 16.3 billion patacas, more than half of that amount was added in April
According to a balance published yesterday in the official bulletin by the Macao Monetary Authority (AMCM), the reserve has been at the highest level since registered in December 2021: 643.2 billion. Still, it remains far from the historical record of 663.6 billion patacas, reached in late February 2021, although the territory is in the middle of covid-19 pandemic. The reserve began 2025 on the rise, with the value of the assets rising 16.3 billion patacas in the first four months. More than half of this amount (8.99 billion of patacas) was won only in April. Official data show that it is the best start of year since the first four months of 2021, when the reserve valued at 42.7 billion patacas. According to AMCM, the reserve had registered in 2024 the best year since the pandemic, earning 35.7 billion patacas. This was the highest annual increase since 2019, when the value of the reserve increased by 70.6 billion patacas. The value of the extraordinary reserve at the end of April this year was 459.7 billion Patacas and the basic reserve, equivalent to 150 percent of the Macao Public Budget, was 164.2 billion patacas. Backdrop The initial budget of the territory for 2025 provides for a 7 percent increase in total expenses to 109.4 billion patacas. The Legislative Assembly is currently discussing a proposal submitted by the government for a new budget, which includes an extra increase of 2.86 billion Patacas in expenses. The Macao Financial Reserve is mostly composed of 257.8 billion Patacas in subcontracted investments, deposits and current accounts of 252.9 billion patacas and even credit securities in the amount of 116.6 billion. In 2024, investments surrendered to the financial reserve nearly 31 billion patacas, corresponding to a 5.3 percent profitability rate, AMCM said in late February.

item.title: UPM | Investigation company with a loss of 47 thousand patacas

item.title: Ormuz Strait | Closing can make inflation trigger
item.description:
The president of the Macao Suppliers Association, IP Sio Man, warns that in case of blocking the impact should begin to be felt within two to three months. Some prices may rise up to 10 percent
The possibility of going on to advance with the closure of the Ormuz Strait can shoot inflation in Macao. The scenario was drawn by the president of the Macao Suppliers Union Association, IP Sio Man, in statements to the newspaper or Mun. After US and Israelite bombings against Iran, the possibility of the country ending the Strait of Ormuz was advanced. IP Sio Man acknowledged that the negative effects of closing will affect mashes to consumer goods prices and should begin to feel more intensely about two to three months after blocking. The Association's president estimated that the closure will lead to the “inevitable increase in prices” from about 5 to 10 percent. Price growth will take about two to three months to feel, because many of the importers and distributors have reserves of products that can be affected, so they can be sold at current prices. However, when new more expensive products are imported, prices in Macau will also reflect this increase. IP Sio Man also indicated that after the beginning of the war between Israel, the US and Iran, the cost of insurance for maritime transport increased by 50 percent. Oil prices rose about six percent. The president of the association also indicated that with the blockade of the Strait of Ormuz, the maritime transport that currently takes three months will take four to five months. Faced with this scenario, IP believes that the impact on the level of goods transport between and Asia and Europe will be similar to what happened during the pandemic. China more protected Despite the negative panorama, IP Sio Man also pointed out that China is better prepared to face the impact than regions such as Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, Macao or others from Southeast Asia. The president pointed out that rail transport between China and Europe can be an alternative for transporting some products and is currently used for most consumed high-class goods, such as wines, liqueurs, dairy products, sweets, chocolates and cookies. An area where Macao should be impacted is at first -need goods, such as cereals, food oil and other foods, since these products originated in the interior of China and the countries of Southeast Asia. The newspaper or Mun article also cites an anonymous supplier that indicates that Europe is not a source of imports in Macao and that the impact should not be much felt. The same anonymous source indicated that since the pandemic, Macau began to diversify the fate of imports of imports, looking for alternatives in Southeast Asia. This supplier also indicated to expect a moderate impact on inflation level, because consumption inside China is in retraction due to the employment crisis on the other side of the border.

item.title: Iran | Approved suspension of cooperation with the AIEA
item.description: The Iranian Parliament yesterday voted to suspend cooperation with the International Atomic Energy Agency following 12-day war marked by Israeli and Americans attacks against Iran's nuclear facilities. Iranian Parliament President Mohammad Bagher Ghalibaf said the International Atomic Energy Agency (AIEA) refused to condemn the attack on Iranian nuclear facilities, compromising the international credibility of the United Nations. Ghalibaf's statements occurred after the deputies voted in favor of the suspension of cooperation with AIEA. "The Iranian organization of atomic energy will suspend cooperation with the AIEA while the safety of nuclear facilities is not guaranteed," added the president of Parliament of Teerão. On June 13, Israel, with the support of the United States, attacked Iranian military and nuclear facilities. Iran retaliated firing missiles and launching unmanned air appliances against Israel. The ceasefire was agreed on Tuesday, after intervention by the US Administration.

item.title: Hong Kong | Justice evaluates appeal by journalist convicted of sedition
item.description: Hong Kong's court will analyze in September a appeal by the first journalist sentenced to the prison sentence under a law of sedition, the region's press advanced yesterday. According to the Hong Kong Free Press news portal, the Court of Appeal marked the hearing requested by Patrick Lam Shiu-Tung, former Stand News' interim writing head. The Stand News News Portal closed doors in December 2021 after a police operation involving 200 police, the company's freezing and the detention of the board, including Patrick Lam. Last October, Lam filed an appeal of the conviction, a month earlier, to 14 months in prison, the first sentence against a journalist under an established sedition law when Hong Kong was an ancient British colony. Although the first instance considered Lam guilty, the chief of writing came out of freedom due to health issues and for already fulfilling 10 months in custody. Also in September, the same court sentenced the former Stand News' chief of writing, Chung Pui-kuen, 21 months in prison by sedition. Judge Kwok Wai-Kin considered Chung and conspiracy culprits for publishing and reproducing seditious materials, along with Best Pencil (Hong Kong) Ltd, the company that owned Stand News. The trial, which began in October 2022, lasted about 50 days, and the verdict was postponed several times.

item.title: Beijing asks to avoid commercial “jungle law” and defends global cooperation
item.description: Chinese Prime Minister Li Qiang warned yesterday against the risks of increasing economic and commercial fragmentation, defending cooperation and multilateralism in the face of containment and risk reduction policies promoted by Western powers. "What the world needs is not the jungle law, but of mutual success through cooperation," Li said, in an implicit reference to protectionist tensions and measures led by the United States to reduce China's dependence on strategic sectors. I was speaking at the inaugural session of the Annual Meeting of New Champions, known as the “Summer Davos” and promoted by the World Economic Forum, which takes place this week in Tianjin, in northeastern China, and brings together political and business leaders from over 90 countries and regions. Transformed In his speech, Chinese prime minister warned of “deep changes” in the international economy, driven by geopolitical tensions, technological transformation and reconfiguration of global supply chains. "The world cannot be a set of isolated islands again. We need more cooperation bridges in which we all win," he said. In a context marked by increasing customs rates, restrictions on foreign investment and calls to economic 'dissociation' with China, I read that global trade and investment should not be politicized or transformed into confrontation instruments. ” He also stressed that China is still committed to dialogue, economic integration and promoting an open multilateral system. "Economic globalization will not stop. It can go through ups and downs, but will continue to advance," he said. Li also highlighted the growing role of emerging economies such as “new engines” of international trade, recalling that they represent about 70 percent of the world's population. This year's edition of “Summer Davos” takes place under the sign of geoeconomic uncertainty and increased protectionism, placing the tonic in the opportunities offered by entrepreneurship and new technologies to boost economic growth and resilience. Participants include heads of government from countries such as Ecuador, Singapore and Vietnam.

item.title: Qingdao | Shangoi Cooperation Organization Meeting Prata
item.description:
The meeting of the Ministers of Defense of Asian countries representing 40% of the world's population happens at the same time as in The Hague, the NATO Summit
The meeting of Ministers of Defense of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, sometimes nicknamed “Nato Asian”, ripped yesterday in the city of Qingdao, northeast of China, in parallel to the Summit of the Transatlantic Alliance in The Hague, which will be provided to give Trump green light for European countries to increase to 5 percent to the financial alliance. The event aims to “consolidate and deepen mutual confidence in military matters” and promote “practical cooperation between the Member States,” said the China Ministry of Defense in a statement. According to the same note, the meeting, which ends today, will contribute to “the maintenance of world and regional peace and stability” and to “common development and prosperity”. Among the highlighted objectives is also the “reinforcement of the organization's ability to combat regional terrorism”. An intervention by Chinese Defense Minister Dong Jun is planned, as China currently exercises the rotating presidency of the organization. Attention will also be facing the eventual participation of Iranian Defense Minister Hosein Dehgán, after he will have accepted a ceasefire with Israel in the last few hours. The meeting in Qingdao occurs in a context of aggravation of tensions in the Middle East in recent weeks. Following the US attack on Iranian nuclear facilities over the weekend, the Shanghai cooperation organization condemned the operation and expressed “serious concern”, considering that it represented “a serious violation of international law” and had “a negative impact on global peace and safety”. Russians at the table The presence of Russian Defense Minister Andréi Beloussov is also planned. Moscow and Beijing have deepened their ties in the defense area in recent years, while China maintains an ambiguous position against the war in Ukraine. Dehgán and Beloussov gathered on Monday, both condemned the attacks of the US and Israel against Iran. The Russian minister also expressed his support to Tehran and classified western requirements in the nuclear domain as a "pretext" to weaken the country. Gigantic coverage The organization includes as members China, Russia, India, Iran, Kazakh, Kidstan, Pakistan, Tajiquistan, Belarus and USBekistan, being considered the world's largest regional organization in terms of geographical coverage and population, covering about 40 percent of the world's population. Although its members claim that this is not a military alliance and that the main objective is to protect the member states from threats such as terrorism, separatism and extremism, analysts consider that the block aims above all to counteract the influence of the NATO.

item.title: Middle East | Facts demonstrate that the military way does not bring peace
item.description: The Chinese government said yesterday that “the facts show that the military way does not bring peace to the Middle East, after US President Donald Trump announced a ceasefire and requesting the parties to respect him. Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun transmitted yesterday at a press conference his hope that "peace will be achieved as soon as possible" and said that "the Pacific dialogue is the right way to solve problems." "We exhort the parties involved to resume the right way to a political solution as soon as possible," added the spokesman, ensuring that China "is willing to collaborate with the international community to make efforts to maintain peace and stability in the Middle East" and "doesn't want tensions to intensify." The Israeli government, led by Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, said yesterday in a statement accepted Trump's proposal to a “bilateral ceasefire” with Iran after reaching his goals in 12 days of war, but warned that Israel will respond “firmly” to any violation of this agreement. "Israel thanks President Trump and the United States for his support in defense and his participation in the elimination of the Iranian nuclear threat," reads in the statement, in reference to US bombing perpetrated on Sunday against three Iranian nuclear facilities in Ford, Natanz and Isfahan. It is still unclear whether the operation, criticized by Beijing, frustrated Iran's uranium enrichment program and its ability to build nuclear weapons.

item.title: Visit | XI defends reinforcement of cooperation with Singapore
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping yesterday defended the “Strengthening of Strategic Communication” with Singapore, during a meeting with the Prime Minister of the Insular Nation, Lawrence Wong, in Beijing. XI, who congratulated Wong for victory in last month's parliamentary elections, indicated that, “in the current international situation of interconnected changes and chaos, China is willing to strengthen strategic communication with Singapore”, according to a statement widespread by state television CCTV. The Chinese leader urged both parties to "strengthen cooperation ties, work together to face challenges, and generate greater benefits to peoples from both countries." Wong said that "the importance of relationships between China and Singapore is greater than ever in a turbulent world situation," according to CCTV. “We can work together to build more narrow bilateral relationships and strengthen regional and multilateral cooperation to strengthen multilateralism, protect international rules and order and benefit all countries in the world,” said Wong, who chose China as his first international official trip outside Southeast Asian after May elections. Unquestionable victory Wong ascended as Prime Minister of Singapore in May 2024, when the predecessor, Lee Hsien Loong, left office after almost two decades in power. In the May elections, his party, the Popular Action Party (PAP), which has been in power in Singapore for six decades, has managed to wage the fall and wage the rise of a reduced opposition, winning 87 of the 97 seats in Parliament. China maintains close relationships with Singapore, where it is estimated that hundreds of Chinese companies have changed in recent years in an attempt to avoid the impact of geopolitical and commercial tensions between Washington and Beijing. Singapore, which has a strong regulatory system and low corporate taxes, also proved to be the ideal alternative to Hong Kong.

item.title: NATO / Defense | US insist on the 5% increase for all allies
item.description: The United States yesterday insisted that their commitment to increase by 5% of defense spending concerns all member countries of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO), gathered in Summit in The Hague. "Thanks to the leadership of the [American] president Donald Trump, NATO is on its way to achieving a historical commitment, in which each ally is committed to spending at least 5 percent of its GDP in defense," said the US ambassador to the Atlantic alliance, Matthew Whitaker, stressing that "all" will have to show "significant progress" in their sector budgets. On the deadlines to reach the goal, Whitaker avoided moving on a date, although he reiterated that "there is no unlimited deadline," so he expects "significant and incredible growth from allies and their defense budgets year after year." In this sense, he added that this is determined by the security threats that the military block faces and not by the demands of Trump or Nato Secretary-General Mark Rutte. "Our opponents will not expect us to be prepared," he warned. In this way, Whitaker reiterated that the US president asks for “a clear and credible plan” to reach 5 percent of defense investment to “whole” to the swim. For Whitaker, the security situation requires European partners to take steps ahead to reinforce the transatlantic bond, so it reiterated that the expense issue will continue on Washington's agenda. "I would expect allies to prove even more vigilant when demanding responsibilities to each other for the progress made year after year," Whitaker said, never mentioning the agreement achieved Sunday by Spain's president, Pedro Sánchez, and by Rutte, to give Madrid more flexibility in his spending trajectory.

item.title: Nobel Peace Nobel | Pakistan criticizes Trump for attacking will
item.description: Pakistan condemned US President Donald Trump for bombarding Iran, less than 24 hours after he said he deserved the Nobel Peace for resolving the recent crisis with India. Relations between the two countries of southern Asia got worse after a massacre of tourists in Caxemira Indiana in April, with the two countries to attack even negotiations led by Washington resulted in a truce attributed to Trump. It was Trump's “decisive diplomatic intervention and leadership” that Pakistan praised in an effusive message on Saturday night when he announced the formal recommendation to receive the Nobel Peace Nobel Prize, Less than 24 hours later, however, he ordered the United States for attacked Iran, stating that the attacks “constituted a serious violation of international law” and the statutes of the International Atomic Energy Agency (AIEA). Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, in a call on Sunday with Iranian President, Masoud Pezeshkian, expressed concern that bombing were visited facilities that were under the safeguard of the AIEA. Pakistan, which has nuclear weapons such as India, has narrow ties with Iran and supports the attacks against Israel with the argument that Tehran has the right to defend itself, according to the US news agency Associated Press (AP).

item.title: Israel/Iran | Conflict complicates air connections between Europe and Asia
item.description: Flights between East Asian and Europe are increasingly long, expensive and unpredictable, pointing out analysts as the conflict between Iran and Israel joins the closing of Russian airspace to European companies. Since the Ukraine invasion of Russia in February 2022, European Union aircrafts have been prohibited from flying over Russian territory, which led to the cancellation of dozens of routes and forced companies to divert by corridors southern or Arctic. In the case of East Asia calls, such as China, Japan or South Korea, the impact translates into additions of up to four hours of flight, extra fuel consumption and, consequently, increased operating costs and ticket prices. In recent days, the intensification of the conflict between Israel and Iran, with military support from the United States, aggravated the situation, leading to the suspension of flights over Iran, Iraq, Syria and Israel. Several companies, including Qatar Airways, Lufthansa and Singapore Airlines, adjusted the routes or canceled calls to the region, citing security reasons. A source of a large European airline quoted by the British newspaper Financial Times under anonymous said that although companies were used to dealing with periodic airspace closures, the current situation is "more serious" because companies have had a "really small corridor" to fly. With the main air corridors blocked north and south, flights between cities such as Beijing, Shanghai, Seoul or Tokyo and destinations in Europe now pass more narrow, flying over Central Asian, Turkey, or the Arabian Peninsula. Dependence on these corridors increases pressure on air traffic controls and makes any local disturbance in a threat to global flow. Gains and Loss Chinese airlines such as Air China and China Eastern, which are still allowed to use Russian airspace, have gained, however, a competitive advantage. Their flights are shorter and cheaper, allowing them to offer tariffs up to 35 percent lower than those practiced by European operators on the same routes, according to an estimate of the Financial Times. In addition to the impact on passenger transport, the logistics sector also records difficulties, with delays in the delivery of goods and increased freight costs. Rosen Röhlig expert pointed out in a report such as “the closing of Russian airspace to European companies affects air loading on Asia Europe Route”, leading to “setbacks in global centers and increased costs and delays”. "The general tendency is an additional tightening in the capacity of carriers. As a result (…), longer crew rotations and increased fuel costs can lead to higher rates and changes in schedules," he said. Also an OECD study demonstrated as "the closing of Russian airspace to carriers from 36 countries caused significant increases in travel time to passengers by about 80 percent of the routes that connect Asia to Europe." The same analysis stressed that alternative corridors “cannot fully absorb these flows”, originating delays in the delivery of goods and increased freight costs, with direct impact on global supply chains. The European Aviation Security Agency (EASA), which maintains regular updates on air exclusion zones, warned that the situation remains volatile, with the risk of new closures or unexpected incidents.

The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia

The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature.
